abstract: Severe restrictions Great Britain has placed on what reporters may reveal about acquittal of terrorism suspect Erol Incedal spotlight nation's growing debate over balance between free speech and national security in era of terrorism; case has prompted accusations that government is avoiding accountability by cloaking its actions in security classifications.
lead_paragraph: A group of journalists are among the very few people who know why a student was finally acquitted of terrorism charges. Problem is, they cannot report what they know.

headline.main: A Terrorism Case in Britain Ends in Acquittal, but No One Can Say Why
headline.print_headline: Terrorism Case Fails, but No One Can Say Why That Happened

snippet: A group of journalists are among the very few people who know why a student was finally acquitted of terrorism charges. Problem is, they cannot report what they know.
